In skeletal muscle, imposed rest increased NRIP1 expression by 80%, and strength training increased expression by 25% compared to baseline. Following rest, NRIP1 expression became sensitive to insulin stimulation. After re-training, NRIP1 expression decreased. wikipathways.name: Mammary gland development pathway - Puberty (Stage 2 of 4)

summary: Nuclear receptor interacting protein 1 (NRIP1) is a nuclear protein that specifically interacts with the hormone-dependent activation domain AF2 of nuclear receptors. Also known as RIP140, this protein modulates transcriptional activity of the estrogen receptor. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
